titleStmt.title: Louis Brown v. J.C. Mitchell and James Bogant. Order granting Writ

bibl.title: Louis Brown v. J.C. Mitchell and James Bogant. Order granting Writ
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: District Court for the Third Judicial District of Washington Territory

body.p: In the District Court of the 3rd Judicial District of Washington Territory Chief Justice Boyle, presiding
Territory of Washington } ss County of King
In the matter of Louis Brown Habeas Corpus

On reading and filing the petition of Louis Brown presented in his behalf by his attorney John E. Costello and duly signed and verified by him whereby it appears that he is illegaly imprisoned and restrained of his liberty by one Mitchell Chief of Police + James Bogant at the city Jail in and for the city of Seattle County of King in the Territory of Washington and stating wherein the illegality consists from which it appears to me that a writ of Habeas Corpus ought to issue

It is ordered that a Writ of Habeas Corpus issue out of and under the seal of the District Court of the 3rd Judicial District of Washington Territory and in and for the County of King directed to the said Mitchell + Bogant commanding them to have the body of the said Louis Brown before me in the Court room, of the said Court on the 22nd day of

November 1888 at 3 o'clock P.M. of that day to do and receive what shall then and there be considered concerning the said Louis Brown together with the time and cause of his detention and that he then and there the said writ
Dated on the 22nd day of November 1888 Charles E. Boyle Judge Third Judicial District
In the matter of Louis Brown Habeas Corpus
